summary: This is an email chain from April 2021 between FBI personnel and US Attorney's Office contractors regarding technical issues with copying and transferring a CD containing files related to Ghislaine Maxwell. The chain discusses corrupted files and the logistics of delivering replacement media.

persons.name: William Bohrer
persons.context: Appears as a recipient (cc'd) on an email discussing the transfer of Maxwell case files. His email address is listed.

events.title: File Transfer Issue Identified
events.description: A contractor reports that four of five folders from a CD related to Maxwell have been uploaded, but one folder (1B 1-14) contains corrupted files that cannot be copied.

events.title: Delivery of Replacement Media
events.description: An FBI Special Agent confirms they will deliver four replacement disks (1B-14, 1B 8-2, 1B 8-7, and 1D-1) to the US Attorney's Office.

locations: 4th floor (of an unspecified office building, likely the US Attorney's Office)
keyFacts: The document is a 2021 email chain concerning the transfer of investigative files related to Ghislaine Maxwell.
Technical issues were encountered with a CD containing Maxwell files, specifically a corrupted folder labeled '1B 1-14'.
The FBI planned to deliver four specific replacement disks (1B-14, 1B 8-2, 1B 8-7, 1D-1) to resolve the issue.
The correspondence involves personnel from the FBI's New York Field Office and contractors for the US Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (USANYS).
Most individual names in the email are redacted or represented by placeholders, with William Bohrer being the only clearly named person.
